title: David Warsh
text:
David Lewis Warsh (born May 25, 1944) is an American <a href="journalist">journalist</a> and <a href="author">author</a> who has generally covered topics in <a href="economics">economics</a> and <a href="finance">finance</a>. Since 2002, he has written and published "Economic Principals", a weekly series of essays about economics and economists.
Early life and education.
Warsh was born in <a href="New%20York%20City">New York City</a>, the son of Leo George and Annis Meade Warsh. He graduated from <a href="Lyons%20Township%20High%20School">Lyons Township High School</a> in <a href="LaGrange%2C%20Illinois">LaGrange, Illinois</a> in 1962, then from <a href="Harvard%20College">Harvard College</a> in 1972 (66-72).
Professional career.
Warsh began his career as a copy-boy at <a href="City%20News%20Bureau%20of%20Chicago">City News Bureau of Chicago</a> and as a staff reporter for "Keene Evening Sentinel" in <a href="Keene%2C%20New%20Hampshire">Keene, New Hampshire</a>. He served 1965-1969 in the US Navy and reported on the <a href="Vietnam%20War">Vietnam War</a> for "<a href="Pacific%20Stars%20and%20Stripes">Pacific Stars and Stripes</a>" and "<a href="Newsweek">Newsweek</a>". He worked briefly for "The Wall Street Journal" and the "<a href="Wilmington%20News%20Journal">Wilmington News-Journal</a>," then covered economics for "<a href="Forbes">Forbes</a>", before joining the staff of "<a href="The%20Boston%20Globe">The Boston Globe</a>" from 1978. The twice-weekly column he began writing there in 1983 ran intermittently in "<a href="The%20Washington%20Post">The Washington Post</a>" and "<a href="Chicago%20Tribune">Chicago Tribune</a>" as well. A two-time winner of <a href="UCLA">UCLA</a>'s <a href="Gerald%20Loeb%20Award">Gerald Loeb Award</a>, in 1977 and in 1989, he was a Fellow of the <a href="American%20Academy%20in%20Berlin">American Academy in Berlin</a> in 2004, receiving its J.P. Morgan International Prize in Finance Policy and Economics.
In March 2002, Warsh left the Globe to write online at <a href="http%3A//www.economicprincipals.com">Economic Principals</a>, his own reader-supported website.. The focus of the website and his writing is "technical economics through the device of weekly profiles of various movers and shakers" as well as various short items. In 2012, the website had some 20,000 readers.
He is home-based in <a href="Somerville%2C%20Massachusetts">Somerville, Massachusetts</a> and is a summer resident of <a href="Portage%20Point%2C%20Michigan">Portage Point</a> near <a href="Onekama%2C%20Michigan">Onekama, Michigan</a>.
In 2012, <a href="Lyons%20Township%20High%20School">Lyons Township High School</a> inducted him into its Hall of Fame.
